sources.full: Ulraunt's Guide to the Planes: Acheron

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the aurochs moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Tactical Discipline
entries: The fist of Bane has advantage on all ability checks and saving throws made during combat.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Tactical Discipline
entries: The iron consul has advantage on all ability checks and saving throws made during combat.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The iron consul makes one attack with its spear and can use its Voice of Command ability.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage when used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Voice of Command
entries: The iron consul selects up to two allies within 90 feet of it that can hear its commands. Each ally can immediately use its reaction to make one melee attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The black gauntlet is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Aura of Terror
entries: When a hostile creature within 5 feet of the black gauntlet makes an attack roll or a saving throw, it has disadvantage on the roll. Creatures that are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition are immune to this trait.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The black gauntlet makes two attacks with its mace.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Guiding Bolt (1st-Level Spell; Requires a Spell Slot)
entries: Ranged Spell Attack:

{@hit 7} to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against the target before the end of the black gauntlet's next turn has advantage. If the black gauntlet casts this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

trait.name: Cavalry Training
entries: When the duergar hits a target with a melee attack while mounted on a female steeder, the steeder can make one melee attack against the same target as a reaction.

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The duergar makes two war pick attacks.

action.name: War Pick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shared Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The duergar magically turns {@condition invisible} for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it casts a spell, or its concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it. While the {@condition invisible} duergar is mounted on a female steeder, the steeder is {@condition invisible} as well. The invisibility ends early on the steeder immediately after it attacks.

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

trait.name: Phalanx Formation
entries: The duergar has advantage on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws while standing within 5 feet of a duergar ally wielding a shield.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: King's Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage while enlarged.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage while enlarged.

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying.

While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strengthbased weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The duergar magically turns {@condition invisible} for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it casts a spell, it uses its Enlarge, or its concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hobgoblin is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Arcane Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the hobgoblin can deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a damaging spell attack if that target is within 5 feet of an ally of the hobgoblin and that ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Army Arcana
entries: When the hobgoblin casts a spell that causes damage or that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, it can choose itself and any number of allies to be immune to the damage caused by the spell and to succeed on the required saving throw.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hobgoblin is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the hobgoblin is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hobgoblin makes four attacks, each of which can be an unarmed strike or a dart attack. It can also use Shadow Jaunt once, either before or after one of the attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: Ranged Weapon Attack. {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shadow Jaunt
entries: The hobgoblin magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.
Both the space it is leaving and its destination must be in dim light or darkness.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Foe Smiter of Ilneval
entries: The orc deals an extra die of damage when it hits with a longsword attack (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc makes two melee attacks with its longsword or two ranged attacks with its javelins. If Ilneval's Command is available to use, the orc can use it after these attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) slashing damage when used with two hands.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Ilneval's Command {@recharge 4}
entries: Up to three allied orcs within 120 feet of this orc that can hear it can use their reactions to each make one weapon attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The orc is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The orc has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc makes two claw attacks, or four claw attacks if it has fewer than half of its hit points remaining.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

monster.name: Orc Hand of Yurtrus
languages: understands Common and Orc but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The orc is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It requires no verbal components to cast its spells. The orc has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

action.name: Touch of the White Hand
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Corrupted Carrier
entries: When the orc is reduced to 0 hit points, it explodes, and any creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned}. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. A creature {@condition poisoned} by this effect can repeat the save at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success. While {@condition poisoned} by this effect, a creature can't regain hit points.

trait.name: Nurtured One of Yurtrus
entries: The orc has advantage on saving throws against poison and disease.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Corrupted Vengeance
entries: The orc reduces itself to 0 hit points, triggering its Corrupted Carrier trait.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the orc can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Hand of Shargaas
entries: The orc deals an 2 extra dice of damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack (included in its attacks).

trait.name: Shargaas's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the orc's darkvision.

trait.name: Slayer
entries: In the first round of a combat, the orc has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn yet. If the orc hits a creature that round who was surprised, the hit is automatically a critical hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc makes two scimitar or dart attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Veil of Shargaas (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The orc casts {@spell darkness} without any components. Wisdom is its spellcasting ability.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the tanarukk can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The tanarukk has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tanarukk makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its greatsword.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Unbridled Fury
entries: In response to being hit by a melee attack, the tanarukk can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the attacker.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The steeder can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Extraordinary Leap
entries: The distance of the steeder's long jumps is tripled; every foot of its walking speed that it spends on the jump allows it to move 3 feet.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Sticky Leg
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}The target is stuck to the steeder's leg and {@condition grappled} until it escapes (escape {@dc 12}). The steeder can have only one creature {@condition grappled} at a time.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The steeder can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Extraordinary Leap
entries: The distance of the steeder's long jumps is tripled; every foot of its walking speed that it spends on the jump allows it to jump 3 feet.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Sticky Leg
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Small or Tiny creature. {@h}The target is stuck to the steeder's leg and {@condition grappled} until it escapes (escape {@dc 12}). The steeder can have only one creature {@condition grappled} at a time.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny maggot.
The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. {@h}The target is infested by {@dice 1d4} rot grubs. At the start of each of the target's turns, the target takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage per rot grub infesting it. Applying fire to the bite wound before the end of the target's next turn deals 1 fire damage to the target and kills these rot grubs. After this time, these rot grubs are too far under the skin to be burned.
If a target infested by rot grubs ends its turn with 0 hit points, it dies as the rot grubs burrow into its heart and kill it. Any effect that cures disease kills all rot grubs infesting the target.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hydroloth's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The hydroloth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The hydroloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The hydroloth's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Secure Memory
entries: The hydroloth is immune to the waters of the River Styx as well as any effect that would steal or modify its memories or detect or read its thoughts.

trait.name: Watery Advantage
entries: While submerged in liquid, the hydroloth has advantage on attack rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydroloth makes two melee attacks. In place of one of these attacks, it can cast one spell that takes 1 action to cast.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Steal Memory (1/Day)
entries: The hydroloth targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target takes {@damage 4d6} psychic damage, and it must make a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw. On a successful save, the target becomes immune to this hydroloth's Steal Memory for 24 hours. On a failed save, the target loses all proficiencies, it can't cast spells, it can't understand language, and if its Intelligence and Charisma scores are higher than 5, they become

5. Each time the target finishes a long rest, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A greater restoration or {@spell remove curse} spell cast on the target ends this effect early.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The hydroloth magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The merrenoloth's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The merrenoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The merrenoloth's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Teleport
entries: As a bonus action, the merrenoloth magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The merrenoloth uses Fear Gaze once and makes one oar attack.

action.name: Oar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fear Gaze
entries: The merrenoloth targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the merrenoloth for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Crow of Unraveling
languages: understands all languages but can't speak

trait.name: Ill Omen
entries: Creatures without this trait have disadvantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects while within 5 feet of the crow.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The crow has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The crow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sending (3/Day)
entries: The crow magically sends a short message of twenty-five words or less to its master, who hears the message in its mind, recognizes the crow as the sender, and can answer in a like manner immediately.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Fzoul is a 20th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Aura of Awe
entries: When a hostile creature within 10 feet of Fzoul makes an attack roll, it has disadvantage on the roll. Creatures that are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition are immune to this trait.

trait.name: Fear Frenzy
entries: Fzoul has advantage on attack rolls against {@condition frightened} creatures.

trait.name: Ill Omen
entries: Creatures without this trait have disadvantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects while within 5 feet of Fzoul.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Fzoul fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Fzoul's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Tactical Discipline
entries: Fzoul has advantage on all ability checks and saving throws made during combat.

trait.name: Tyrant
entries: Fzoul deals an additional 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage whenever he hits a target that is {@condition frightened} of him with a melee attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Fzoul uses his Dreadful Aspect. He then makes three melee weapon attacks in any combination.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage. If the target is a creature, Fzoul can grapple it (escape {@dc 21}) instead of dealing the slashing damage.

action.name: Scepter of the Chosen Tyrant
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed a {@dc 21} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn. If a creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it can't benefit from immunity to the {@condition frightened} condition for the next hour.

action.name: Dreadful Aspect
entries: Fzoul exudes magical menace. Each enemy within 30 feet of Fzoul must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. Creatures within 10 feet of Fzoul have disadvantage on the saving throw. If a {@condition frightened} target ends its turn more than 30 feet away from Fzoul, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Tyrannical Stare {@recharge 5}
entries: Fzoul targets one creature he can see within 30 feet of him. The target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by Fzoul until Fzoul dies or until he is on a different plane of existence from the target. The {@condition charmed} target is under Fzoul's control and can't take reactions, and Fzoul and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.

Whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends, but the target and each creature within 5 feet of it each take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage.

legendary.name: Ashes to Ashes (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Fzoul casts the {@spell delayed blast fireball} spell.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Fzoul makes a melee weapon attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Fzoul moves up to his speed.

legendary.name: Tyrannical Stare (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Fzoul uses his Tyrannical Stare action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: Morndin's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 21}). Morndin can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Morndin is a 20th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Arcane Weapons
entries: Morndin's weapon attacks are magical. When Morndin hits with a weapon, the weapon deals an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) force damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Army Arcana
entries: When Morndin casts a spell that causes damage or that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, he can choose himself and any number of allies to be immune to the damage caused by the spell and to succeed on the required saving throw.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Morndin fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Morndin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiaction
entries: Morndin casts a spell and makes two Gloomhammer attacks.

action.name: Gloomhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) force damage, or 24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) force damage while enlarged. If the attack hits a creature, the target is also affected by one of the following options of Morndin's choice:

action.name: Arcane Feedback
entries: The target must make a {@dc 21} Intelligence saving throw, taking force damage equal to twice its total number of unspent spell slots on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Arcane Gloom
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Charisma saving throw or be unable to benefit from spells and other magical effects until the end of Morndin's next turn. Any ongoing beneficial effect is suppressed as though the creature is in an {@spell antimagic field} spell.

action.name: Arcane Instability
entries: The target must make a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes cursed for 1 minute. While cursed in this manner, whenever the target expends a spell slot, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 1 to 3, the arcane energies become uncontrollable and the target rolls on the Wild Magic Surge table available for the wild magic sorcerer (see chapter 3 of the Player's Handbook). On a roll of 4 to 6, the arcane energies explode as they are released, causing the spell or effect to fizzle with no effect.

action.name: Enlarge {@recharge}
entries: For 1 minute, Morndin magically increases in size, along with anything he is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, Morndin is Large, doubles his damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If Morndin lacks the room to become Large, he attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

action.name: Invisibility {@recharge 4}
entries: Morndin magically turns {@condition invisible} for up to 1 hour or until he attacks, casts a spell, uses his Enlarge, or his concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment Morndin wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with him.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Morndin makes a weapon attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Morndin casts a spell.

legendary.name: Cast At-Will Spell
entries: Morndin casts a spell he can cast at will.

trait.name: 20 (+35 22 (+6) 24 (+7) Saving Throws Str +16, Con +15, Wis +14 Skills Athletics +24, Acrobatics +13, Insight +11, Intimidation +11, Perception +11, Persuasion +11 Damage Resistances radiant Damage Immunities cold, fire, lightning, poison, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks Condition Immunities blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, poisoned Senses truesight 120 ft
entries: , passive perception 21 Languages Abyssal, Common, Dwarvish, Elvish, Infernal, Orc Challenge 27 (105,000 XP) Aggressive. As a bonus action, Obould can move up to his speed toward a hostile creature he can see. Divine Destroyer. Creatures who aren't deities can't benefit from any resistances or immunities from Obould's attacks, spells, or effects. Gruumsh's Fury. Obould deals two extra dice of damage when he hits with a weapon attack (included in the attack). Innate Spellcasting. Obould's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (save {@dc 23}). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: {@spell detect evil and good}, {@spell dispel magic}, {@spell fireball} 1/day each: {@spell dispel evil and good}, {@spell fire storm}, {@spell teleport} Legendary {@spell Resistance} (3/Day). If Obould fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead. Magic Resistance. Obould has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Superior Athleticism. Obould has advantage on all ability checks and saving throws involving Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution. In addition, his jump distance is doubled, and he can use the Grapple and Shove actions against creatures of Huge size or smaller. Survivor. Obould regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn, if he has fewer than half hit points. This trait does not function if Obould starts his turn with 0 hit points. Actions Multiattack. Obould uses Demand Obedience and makes two attacks with Ragecinder. He can replace one or both attacks with his Fiery Javelin. Ragecinder (greatsword). Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) slashing damage plus 27 ({@damage 6d8}) fire damage. If the target is a creature, Obould can choose one of the following additional effects: Cleave. Obould chooses another creature within 5 feet of the target. If the original attack would have hit the second creature, it takes half the original damage rolled. Distract. The next attack roll against the creature by an attacker other than Obould has advantage if the attack is made before the start of Obould's next turn. Kill. If the target had less than 10 hit points before being hit by this attack, Obould instantly kills the target. Trip. The target must succeed on a {@dc 25} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Fiery Javelin. Obould conjures a javelin made of flames and hurls it at a creature he can see within 600 feet of him. The javelin strikes unerringly and forces the target to make a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw. On a successful save, the target takes 22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) fire damage and the javelin disappears. On a failed save, the target is knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition restrained} as the javelin pierces its body and pins it to the closest solid surface. A pinned creature takes 22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end these conditions and make the javelin disappear by using its action to make a {@dc 20} Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. Fiery Arena (Recharge 6). Obould creates a magical ring of fire around himself and at least one other creature of his choice. The ring can be up to 30 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. It otherwise functions like the {@spell wall of fire} spell (save {@dc 23}), except Obould doesn't need to concentrate on it and can prematurely dismiss it as a bonus action. Reactions Unyielding. When Obould is subjected to an effect that would move him, knock him {@condition prone}, or both, he is neither moved nor knocked {@condition prone}. Legendary Actions Obould can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. He regains use of legendary actions at the start of his turn. Attack (Costs 2 Actions). Obould attacks once with Ragecinder. Command Allies. Obould chooses up to three allies he can see within 30 feet of him. If a chosen creature can see or hear Obould, it can make one weapon attack as a reaction, with advantage on the attack roll. Fiery Might (Costs 2 Actions). Obould uses his Fiery Javelin or Fiery Arena action. Frighten Foes (Costs 3 Actions). Obould glares at up to five creatures within 30 feet of him. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of Obould until the end of Obould's next turn. Any target within 5 feet of Obould has disadvantage on the saving throw. Tactical Repositioning. Obould moves up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If Kazaht moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 22 ({@damage 5d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Bahgtru's Chosen
entries: Kazaht always knows the location of his master, Bahgtru, so long as they are each on the same plane of existence. As a bonus action, he can magically teleport into the same space as Bahgtru, appearing underneath him. In addition, if Bahgtru casts {@spell teleport} or plane shift on himself while riding Kazaht, he can make target Kazaht the target of spell as well.

trait.name: Divine Steed
entries: Kazaht is unaffected by difficult terrain and can't be surprised.
He also has advantage on all ability checks and saving throws, and is permanently under the effect of a mindblank spell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If Kazaht fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Kazaht's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long rest)
entries: If Kazaht would be reduced to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Kazaht makes two gore attacks.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 5d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (3/Day)
headerEntries: Thokk can cast the commune with nature and plane shift spells. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom.

trait.name: Feral Instinct
entries: Thokk can't be surprised and has advantage on initiative rolls.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Thokk fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Ninefingers' Rage
entries: Thokk adds 8 damage to his melee weapon attacks that use Strength (included in the attack) and has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. In addition, attacks that target Thokk's allies within 5 feet of him are made with disadvantage.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, Thokk can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls he makes during that turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: Thokk's long jump is up to 60 feet and his high jump is up to 50 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Thokk wields Artery Breaker, a magical +3 glaive. He also wears a set of bracers of defense and a ring of protection.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: Thokk adds his Constitution modifier to his AC.

trait.name: Undaunted (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When Thokk is reduced to 0 hit points, he must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 0 + the damage taken. On a success, Thokk drops to 1 hit point instead. Each time Thokk uses this trait after the first, the DC increases by 5.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Thokk makes three attacks with Artery Breaker.

action.name: Artery Breaker
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 20} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 1d10 + 21}) slashing damage. If Thokk scores a critical hit, he rolls damage dice five times instead of twice.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 1d4 + 18}) piercing damage in melee or 12 ({@dice 1d4 + 10}) when thrown.

legendary.name: Artery Breaker Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Thokk makes a melee attack with

legendary.name: Blink
entries: Thokk magically teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 30 feet of him.

legendary.name: Dagger Attack
entries: Thokk makes a dagger attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Thokk moves up to his speed.

legendary.name: Wield
entries: Thokk causes Artery Breaker to magically reappear in his hand.

trait.name: Diamond Soul (1/Turn)
entries: Thynaedius can reroll a failed saving throw.

trait.name: Martial Arts Master
entries: Thynaedius can take a bonus action on each of his turns to gain one of the following effects:

trait.name: Flurry of Blows
entries: Thynaedius makes one additional unarmed strike or Ferrous Blade attack.

trait.name: Patient Defense
entries: Thynaedius takes the Dodge action.

trait.name: Step of the Wind
entries: Thynaedius takes the Disengage or Dash action, and his jump distance is doubled for the turn.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Thynaedius wears an Insignia of Claws, granting him a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with unarmed strikes. He wears a Cloak of Protection and a Ring of Protection, both of which grant him a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws. He also wears a Ring of Mind Shielding, making him immune to spells that allow other creatures to read his thoughts, determine whether he is lying, know his alignment, or know his creature type, and creatures can telepathically communicate with Thynaedius only if he allows it.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While Thynaedius is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, his AC includes his Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Stunning Strikes
entries: When Thynaedius hits a creature with his glaive or an unarmed strike, the target must also succeed on a DC20 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of Thynaedius' next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Thynaedius uses his Long Death Soul. He then makes two glaive attacks and one unarmed strike. He can replace the unarmed strike with a Ferrous Blade attack.

action.name: Glaive +3
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d10 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ferrous Blade
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, Thynaedius can choose one of the following additional effects:

action.name: Controlled Oxidization
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of Thynaedius' next turn.

action.name: Shredding Blades
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute.

action.name: Long Death Soul
entries: Thynaedius' deathly soul rips itself partially from his body to tear at the fears of others. Each creature within 30 feet of Thynaedius that he can see must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of Thynaedius' next turn.

reaction.name: Whenever Thynaedius uses one of the following reactions, roll a d6
entries: On a roll of 4 or higher, he regains the use of his reaction.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
entries: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, Thynaedius deflects the missile. The damage he takes from the attack is reduced by
{@dice 1d10 + 23}. If the damage is reduced to 0, Thynaedius catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and Thynaedius has a hand free.

reaction.name: Ki Parry
entries: Thynaedius adds {@dice 1d10} to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, he must see the attacker.

reaction.name: Slow Fall
entries: When Thynaedius takes damage from falling, he can reduce the damage by 85.

monster.name: Yrrga
languages: understands all languages but can't speak

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When Yrrga is killed, it implodes before releasing a wave of reality-shattering energy. Each creature and object within 1 mile of Yrrga takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) cold damage, 55 ({@damage 10d10}) psychic damage, and 55 ({@damage 10d10}) radiant damage. Each damage type can be reduced by half with a successful {@dc 25} saving throw: Dexterity against cold, Wisdom against psychic, and Constitution against radiant. Additionally, a creature that fails all three saving throws is magically transported to a random layer on a random plane that isn't the plane the creature is currently on. If a creature dies from this damage, its corpse is sent adrift in a random location within the Astral Sea.

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: Yrrga can't wear or carry anything.

trait.name: Gravitational Field
entries: Yrrga distorts gravity within 120 feet of it. Within the area, a creature's walking speed is magically halved and jumping distances are tripled, though a creature can only jump in a straight line and doesn't fall at the end of a jump. Creatures that don't have a flying speed and aren't in touch with the ground float in place, oscillating slightly.

trait.name: Great Old One
entries: Yrrga can't be surprised, has advantage on ability checks and saving throws, automatically succeeds on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws, and it can't be damaged by cantrips. In addition, Yrrga is permanently under the effects of the detect evil and good, detect magic, and {@spell detect thoughts} spells, is unaffected by difficult terrain, and if a creature scores a critical hit against Yrrga, it becomes a normal hit.

trait.name: Harbinger of Nihilism
entries: Whenever a creature with a Yrrga Indoctrination score deals damage to Yrrga or targets Yrrga with a harmful spell, the creature takes psychic damage equal to 5 x its Yrrga Indoctrination score and its hit point maximum is reduced by the same amount.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If Yrrga fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Out-of-Phase Movement. Yrrga can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Each creature it moves through takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage; no creature can take this damage more than once per turn.
Yrrga takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Singularity
entries: Magical darkness extends 30 feet from Yrrga. No light can exist within the area, whether magical or mundane. A creature that starts its turn within this darkness takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) cold damage.

In addition, when a creature that can see Yrrga and starts its turn within 120 feet of Yrrga, it must make a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw. A creature that fails the save takes 26 ({@damage 4d12}) psychic damage and makes attack rolls and ability checks with disadvantage until the start of its next turn.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see Yrrga until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at Yrrga in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

action.name: Glimpse Eternity
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 17} to hit, range 120 feet, one target. {@h}44 ({@damage 8d10}) psychic damage.

action.name: Collapse Distance
entries: Yrrga warps space around a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. That creature must make a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, is magically teleported up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space Yrrga can see. All other creatures within 10 feet of the target's original space each take 65 ({@damage 10d12}) psychic damage. On a successful save, the target takes 32 ({@damage 5d12}) psychic damage.

action.name: Mind Shatter
entries: Each creature of Yrrga's choice that is within 120 feet of Yrrga and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it also becomes insane until it finishes a long rest. While insane, a creature can't take actions, can't understand what other creatures say, can't read, and can speak only in gibberish. A {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic can end the insanity effect early. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Yrrga's Aura of Madness for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Indoctrinate
entries: Yrrga targets one creature it can see or one creature it can sense with its Sense Nihilism trait. The target is overcome by increasingly nihilistic thoughts and must make a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature's Yrrga Indoctrination score increases by 1 (see the Yrrga Indoctrination table). If Yrrga can see the creature, its Yrrga Indoctrination score instead increases by {@dice 1d8}. A creature can only be affected by this action once every 24 hours.
A creature isn't aware that something is affecting its mind unless it succeeds a saving throw with an Yrrga Indoctrination score of 5 or higher.

action.name: Call Brood (1/Day)
entries: Yrrga conjures forth any number of voidlings, void hierophants, and void titans in spaces within 120 feet of it, so long as their combined CR doesn't exceed 30. The conjured creatures act on their own initiative and lack legendary actions if they have them. The conjured creatures enact Yrrga's will without question.

reaction.name: Void Absorption
entries: When Yrrga takes damage, it reduces that damage to 0.

legendary.name: Glimpse Eternity
entries: Yrrga attacks with its Glimpse Eternity.

legendary.name: Collapse Distance (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Yrrga uses its Collapse Distance.

legendary.name: Indoctrinate (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Yrrga uses its Indoctrinate.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Yrrga teleports up to 100 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The achaierai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Smell Poison
entries: The achaierai has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell to detect {@condition poisoned} creatures and on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track a {@condition poisoned} creature. In addition, the achaierai can sense {@condition poisoned} creatures as if it had blindsight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The achaierai makes three attacks: one with its beak and two with its claws.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature and the achaierai doesn't already have two creatures {@condition grappled}, the achaierai can grapple the target (escape {@dc 15}) instead of dealing damage. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Black Cloud {@recharge 5}
entries: The achaierai releases a 10-foot-radius sphere of black, choking gas centered on a point within 30 feet of it. The cloud spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The cloud remains for 1 minute before dispersing.

Each creature that is completely within the cloud at the start of its turn begins to suffocate and must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw against poison. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage, can't take reactions, and must roll a {@dice d10} at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn. A creature that fails its saving throw by 5 or more is also {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half the poison damage but is otherwise unaffected. Creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to poison automatically succeed on this saving throw. {@dice d10} Effect 1 The creature is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.
2-6 The creature doesn't move or take actions this turn.
7-8 The creature uses its action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there is no creature within its reach, the creature does nothing this turn.
9-10 The creature can act and move normally.
A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the cloud after 4 rounds. A strong wind (at least 20 miles per hour) disperses it after 1 round.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Death Spill
entries: If the aorn dies, all precious metals and stones inside it that haven't been obliterated spill out around the corpse.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The aorn can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the aorn doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Feed on Treasure
entries: If the aorn eats precious metals or stones, such as coins or gems, with a value of 500 gp or more, its size increases by one category and it regains 21 ({@dice 2d8 + 12}) hit points. If there isn't enough room for the aorn to increase in size, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

For each size category above Medium, the aorn gets a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls, its AC increases by 1, and the reach of its melee attacks increases by 5 feet. While the aorn is Large or bigger, it makes Strength checks and saving throws with advantage.

If the aorn starts its turn at Gargantuan size, the aorn shatters. Each creature within 60 feet of the aorn must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The valuables inside the aorn are obliterated in the process and 2 Medium aorns appear in an unoccupied space the previous aorn occupied before shattering. Each new aorn has hit points equal to half the original aorn's, rounded down.

trait.name: Treasure Sense
entries: The aorn can pinpoint, by scent, the location of precious metals and stones, such as coins and gems, within 60 feet of it.

trait.name: Variable Illumination
entries: The aorn sheds bright light of any color in a 5- to 30- foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The aorn can alter the radius and color as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aorn makes three claw attacks, one bite attack, and two tentacle attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it loses precious metals and stones in its possession worth {@dice 6d100} gp, rounded down.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The arrowhawk doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The arrowhawk makes one attack with its bite and fires one lightning ray.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lightning Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) lightning damage.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The arrowhawk doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The arrowhawk makes one attack with its bite and fires one lightning ray.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lightning Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 5d8}) lightning damage.

trait.name: Current Accumulation
entries: Whenever the arrowhawk is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and gains 1 static charge.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The arrowhawk doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Static Charges
entries: The arrowhawk absorbs static energy from its surroundings, which accumulates in static charges. Roll a {@dice d6} at the end of each of the arrowhawk's turns; on a roll of 4 or higher, the arrowhawk gains a static charge. It can have up to 3 static charges at any one time.
The arrowhawk can expend a static charge as a bonus action, to create one of the following effects:

trait.name: Freedom
entries: The arrowhawk escapes from nonmagical restraints and can't be {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained} until the end of its turn.

trait.name: Overload
entries: The arrowhawk increases the range of its next Lightning Ray this turn to 120 feet.

trait.name: Zap
entries: The arrowhawk makes its next bite attack this turn with advantage and deals an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage on a hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The arrowhawk makes one attack with its bite and fires one lightning ray.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lightning Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 5d8}) lightning damage.

trait.name: Current Accumulation
entries: Whenever the arrowhawk is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and gains 1 static charge.

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the arrowhawk dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage for each static charge remaining on the arrowhawk on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that are wearing armor made of metal have disadvantage on the saving throw.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The arrowhawk doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Static Charges
entries: The arrowhawk absorbs static energy from its surroundings.
It starts combat with 3 static charges and it gains {@dice 1d4} static charges at the end of each of its turns. It can have up to 6 static charges at any one time.
If the arrowhawk starts its turn with 6 static charges, it dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The arrowhawk spends {@dice 1d4} static charges, making a lightning ray attack for each expended charge.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lightning Ray (Costs 1 Static Charge)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) lightning damage.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The axiomatic arrowhawk doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Linked Minds
entries: The axiomatic arrowhawk can communicate telepathically with all other axiomatic arrowhawks within 300 feet of it. If one of the arrowhawks isn't surprised at the start of combat, none of them are.

trait.name: Smite Chaos (1/Day)
entries: When the axiomatic arrowhawk makes a weapon attack against a creature of chaotic alignment, it deals an additional 5 damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The axiomatic arrowhawk makes one attack with its bite and fires one lightning ray.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lightning Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 5d8}) lightning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The naga is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}), and it needs only verbal components to cast spells.
It has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The naga can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The naga has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Master of Wands
entries: Attuning to a wand doesn't count against the naga's attunement limit.

trait.name: Prehensile Tentacles
entries: The naga has ten tentacles on its chin, which can each grasp and manipulate small objects such as tools or wands. However, it can't wield weapons or shields with them.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If it dies, the naga returns to life in {@dice 1d6} days and regains all its hit points. Only a {@spell wish} spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The naga makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stinger.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target, {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}).
Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained} and takes 27 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns, and the naga can't constrict another target.

action.name: Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target, {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} this way.

trait.name: Indomitable (1/Day)
entries: The bladeling rerolls a failed saving throw.

trait.name: Into the Fray
entries: The bladeling adds a {@dice d8} to its initiative rolls.

trait.name: Spiked Skin
entries: If a creature touches the bladeling or hits it with a melee weapon attack while within 5 feet of it, the creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bladeling makes three melee attacks or two spike attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage if the bladeling has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage if the bladeling has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

action.name: Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the bladeling has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

action.name: Razor Storm (1/Day)
entries: The bladeling launches a barrage of spikes in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Immobile Stance
entries: The bonespear can use this feature as a bonus action to anchor itself to or loosen itself from the ground. While anchored, the bonespear has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid being moved against its will. However, the bonespear's movement speed can't exceed 0 and it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The bonespear regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point remaining.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The bonespear can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Wounded Assault
entries: While it has 100 hit points or fewer, the bonespear has advantage on attack rolls and immediately becomes surrounded by a strange, green fog, which spreads into a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the bonespear. The fog is opaque, causing the area to be heavily obscured.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bonespear makes two attacks with its horns and one with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 60 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}) and pulled into the bonespear's space. Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the bonespear can't use the same horn on another target. A creature that starts its turn {@condition grappled} by one of the bonespear's horns must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until cured and suffer an additional effect based on the type of horn used:

action.name: Enfeebling Horn
entries: The target's Strength score reduced by {@dice 1d4} for as long as it remains {@condition poisoned}. Each time the target fails the saving throw after the first, its Strength score is reduced by a further {@dice 1d4}. A creature dies if its Strength score is reduced to 0 in this manner.

action.name: Sedating Horn
entries: The target's Dexterity score is reduced by {@dice 1d4} for as long as it remains {@condition poisoned}. Each time the target fails the saving throw after the first, its Dexterity score is reduced by a further {@dice 1d4}. A creature dies if its Dexterity score is reduced to 0 in this manner.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The caedes' innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 24}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the caedes fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Unless it wishes to be affected, the caedes is immune to spells of 6th level or lower. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The caedes regains 50 hit points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The caedes deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The caedes can use its Despairing Presence. It then makes four attacks: one with its bite, one with its tail, and two lightning blasts. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 20} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 4d12 + 10}) piercing damage plus 22 ({@damage 4d10}) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the caedes can't bite another target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 20} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage plus 22 ({@damage 4d10}) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 28} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Lightning Blast
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 19} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}53 ({@damage 8d10 + 9}) lightning damage.

action.name: Obliteration Wave {@recharge}
entries: Each creature within 120 feet of the caedes must make a {@dc 27} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) lightning damage and 54 ({@damage 12d8}) thunder damage, and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Despairing Presence
entries: Each creature of the caedes' choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature is also {@condition stunned} while {@condition frightened} in this manner. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the caedes is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the caedes' Despairing Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The caedes makes one bite attack against a Huge or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the caedes, and it takes 88 ({@damage 16d10}) lightning damage at the start of each of the caedes' turns.

If the caedes takes 150 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the caedes must succeed on a {@dc 30} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the caedes. If the caedes dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Cast Innate At-Will Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The caedes casts an innate spell it can cast at will.

legendary.name: Lightning Blast
entries: The caedes makes a lightning blast attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The caedes moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The caedes makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.

If the caedes dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The chronotyryn's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.
It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 23}), requiring no components:

trait.name: Adamantine Feathers
entries: Any critical hit against the chronotyryn becomes a normal hit.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the chronotyryn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Timeless Senses
entries: The chronotyryn has the following senses:

trait.name: Foresight
entries: The chronotyryn can't be surprised and has advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. Additionally, other creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against the chronotyryn.

trait.name: Hindsight
entries: The chronotyryn has perfect memory and knows the detailed history of any creature it sees.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chronotyryn uses its Feather Flurry or Sonic Screech if it can.
It then makes two temporal weapon attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Temporal Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 6d6 + 7}) bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (chronotyryn's choice). This is magical damage that transcends time and hit points lost as a result of this damage can't be restored by any means for 24 hours.

action.name: Feather Flurry {@recharge 5}
entries: The chronotyryn launches a barrage of sharp, adamantine feathers in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Sonic Screech (1/Day)
entries: The chronotyryn releases a burst of incredible sound.

Each creature within 30 feet of the chronotyryn that can hear it must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) thunder damage and is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition paralyzed}.

legendary.name: Cast Innate Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The chronotyryn casts a spell it can cast innately.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The chronotyryn makes a claw attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The chronotyryn moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Temporal Escape (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The chronotyryn disappears until the next creature in the initiative order finishes its turn, at which point it reappears in the closest unoccupied space to the space it disappeared from. Though it is only gone for a split-second, it has spent an hour away, gaining the benefits of a short rest, expending up to 3 hit dice to regain lost hit points, and recharging its Feather Flurry.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Quick Climb
entries: The clockroach doesn't provoke opportunity attacks while climbing.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The clockroach can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The clockroach makes two pincer attacks.

action.name: Pincer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Acid Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The clockroach exhales acid in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 4d4}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If this acid is spewed on a corpse, it begins to dissolve, disappearing completely after 8 hours.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision

trait.name: Metallic Melody (Recharges after a Short or Long rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the devil can begin to a chant for 1 minute, or until the devil is {@condition incapacitated}, producing horrid, rhythmic shrieking that sounds like metal rasping against metal. Any hostile creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the devil and is concentrating on a spell must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC = 10 + the spell's level) or lose concentration. In addition, whenever an affected creature attempts to cast a spell that requires concentration, it must succeed on the same saving throw or the spell fails and the spell slot is wasted. Deafened creatures, constructs, and undead are unaffected by this trait.

trait.name: Superior Pack Tactics
entries: The devil has advantage on attack rolls and saving throws if at least one of its allies is within 5 feet of the devil and the ally is not {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The devil makes two greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large or smaller and wielding a shield, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed 5 feet away from the devil and have its shield shattered.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Asmodeus' Shield
entries: While the devil has more than half its hit points, it is immune to radiant damage.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The devil's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The devil makes three attacks: two with its siege pike and one with its shield bash. It can use Hurl Flame in place of any melee attack.

action.name: Siege Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage. This attack deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d4 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Hurl Flame
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 150 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it also catches fire.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (at will)
headerEntries: The dreadmaster can innately cast alter self, arcane eye, and detect magic. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dreadmaster is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

spells: {@spell eldritch blast} (4 beams, range 300 ft., +5 bonus to each damage roll)

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the dreadmaster's darkvision.

trait.name: Dominating Aura
entries: Any creature hostile to dreadmaster that starts its turn within 20 feet of the dreadmaster must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw, unless the dreadmaster is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn. A creature that is immune to the {@condition frightened} condition is not immune to this effect unless its CR or level is higher than that of the dreadmaster. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the dreadmaster's Dominating Aura the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Imposing Will
entries: The dreadmaster can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While active, the dreadmaster gains one of the following effects.

trait.name: Dire Lord
entries: When a spell or effect would cause the dreadmaster to become cursed, {@condition deafened}, diseased, or {@condition poisoned}, the dreadmaster can use its reaction to force another creature within 20 feet to make a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the dreadmaster transfers the condition or effect from itself unto the target.

trait.name: Gyre Aura
entries: The dreadmaster is surrounded by a strong wind (20 miles per hour) which extinguishes unprotected flames that are torch-sized or smaller, hedges out vapor, gas, and fog that can be dispersed by strong wind. In addition, a ranged weapon attack has disadvantage if the attacks passes through the wind.

trait.name: Harrow
entries: A hostile creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the dreadmaster takes 10 force damage as waves of {@condition invisible}, eldritch magic continuously pulse from the dreadmaster.

trait.name: Inspire Fanatical Loyalty
entries: Allies that are subservient to the dreadmaster and creatures {@condition charmed} by the dreadmaster's magic do as commanded, even if it means certain death, without wavering loyalty or the spell ending.

trait.name: Tactical Discipline
entries: The dreadmaster has advantage on all ability checks and saving throws made during combat.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dreadmaster makes two rod attacks.

action.name: Rod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and have its movement speed reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Shared Invisibility
entries: The dreadmaster magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks, casts a spell, or its concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell).

Any equipment the dreadmaster wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it. While the {@condition invisible} dreadmaster is within 30 feet of its special cohort, the special cohort is {@condition invisible} as well. The invisibility ends early on the special cohort immediately after it attacks or casts a spell.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The duergar's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The duergar can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Psionic Form
entries: When the duergar is reduced to 0 hit points or dies while not in psionic form, it regains half its hit point maximum and transforms into a psionic form along with its equipment. In this form, the duergar gains resistance to all damage, it can't regain hit points, and it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, but it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if he ends his turn inside an object. Its statistics otherwise remain the same. The duergar transforms back into its normal form after 1 hour, regaining all lost hit points.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
