trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the hobgoblin can deal an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the hobgoblin that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the hobgoblin is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hobgoblin makes four attacks, each of which can be an unarmed strike or a dart attack. It can also use Shadow Jaunt once, either before or after one of the attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shadow Jaunt
entries: The hobgoblin magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.
Both the space it is leaving and its destination must be in dim light or darkness.

trait.name: Chameleon Carapace
entries: The gridelin can change the color of its carapace to match the color and texture of its surroundings. As a result, it has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Drone
entries: While flying, the gridelin produces a horrid droning sound to which other gridelins are immune. Any other creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the gridelin and can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be unable to concentrate on spells and effects until the start of its next turn. A creature that can't hear the droning automatically succeeds on the save. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Hive Mind
entries: While the gridelin is within 30 feet of at least one other gridelin, it is resistant to psychic damage, and immune to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The gridelin has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the gridelin's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Spell-Absorbing Chitin
entries: Any time the gridelin is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 4 to 5, the gridelin is unaffected. On a 6, the gridelin is unaffected and gains 20 temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gridelin makes one booming blade attack and two attacks with its crackling claw.

action.name: Booming Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target, {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it becomes sheathed in booming energy until the start of the gridelin's next turn. If the target willingly moves before then, it immediately takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage and must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Crackling Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target, {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage.

resist.note: from attacks that aren't bathed in the blood of a deity

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the hecatoncheires dies, a wave of proto-divinity is released, bursting outwards from the hecatoncheires for 20 miles before dissipating. For the next 24 hours, the affected region gains the effect of an {@spell antimagic field} and each deity touched by the wave becomes mortal.

trait.name: Empowered Attacks
entries: The hecatoncheires' attacks and Weapon Flurry are treated as magical and adamantine for the purpose of bypassing resistance and immunity to nonmagical weapons.

trait.name: Fifty Heads
entries: The hecatoncheires always succeeds on Wisdom (Perception) checks and notices everything it can perceive within 120 feet of it.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the hecatoncheires fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The hecatoncheires has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The hecatoncheires can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

trait.name: Rooting Tentacles
entries: While the hecatoncheires is rooted to the ground, it gains the following benefits and detriments:

trait.name: Benefits
entries: The hecatoncheires gains plane-wide tremorsense, the earth gradually blackens, fauna and flora randomly wither and die, emotions and sounds are strangely dulled, and the hecatoncheires can cause up to 50 tons worth of a structure of its choice to collapse at the end of each of its turns. These benefits affect the entire celestial body the hecatoncheires is rooted into. The hecatoncheires can also cast and concentrate on the {@spell earthquake} spell (save {@dc 23}) at will, centered on itself. It automatically succeeds on Dexterity saving throws against the spell.

trait.name: Detriments
entries: The hecatoncheires' speed is 0, it can't have anything {@condition grappled} with its tentacles, and it can't use its tentacle attack or its Titanic Leap.

trait.name: Storm of Swords
entries: The first time a creature moves within 15 feet of the hecatoncheires on a turn or starts its turn there, the hecatoncheires can use its Weapon Flurry against it (no action required).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hecatoncheires uses its Weapon Flurry twice. It can't use both against the same target.

action.name: Antediluvian Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 20} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d10 + 10}) bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage.

action.name: Boulder
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 500 ft., one target. {@h}65 ({@damage 10d10 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 28} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Weapon Flurry
entries: The hecatoncheires unleashes a flurry of attacks against a target within 15 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 28} Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful save.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 20} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 28}).
Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Titanic Leap (Recharges After a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The hecatoncheires uses one of the following leaps while outside:

action.name: Interplanar Leap
entries: The hecatoncheires jumps upwards with such force that it breaks through planar boundaries as if casting the {@spell plane shift} spell. The hecatoncheires appears on a plane of its choosing, 20 miles above the ground and comes crashing down, creating a shockwave upon impact.

Both the jump and the fall take 1 minute. Each creature within 60 feet of the hecatoncheires when it lands, must make a {@dc 28} Strength saving throw, taking 132 ({@damage 24d10}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful save. A creature in the hecatoncheires' space has disadvantage on the saving throw.

action.name: Intraplanar Leap
entries: The hecatoncheires jumps up to 20 miles with a travel time of 2 miles per round. The hecatoncheires lands at the end of its turn, creating a shockwave upon impact. Each creature within 60 feet of the hecatoncheires when it lands must make a {@dc 28} Strength saving throw, taking 132 ({@damage 24d10}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful save. A creature in the hecatoncheires' space has disadvantage on the saving throw.

legendary.name: Boulder (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The hecatoncheires makes a boulder attack.

legendary.name: Root/Uproot
entries: The hecatoncheires burrows its tentacles into the ground or retracts them, gaining or losing the effects described in the Rooting Tentacles trait.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The hecatoncheires moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Multiattack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The hecatoncheires uses its Multiattack action.

legendary.name: Sword
entries: The hecatoncheires attacks with an antediluvian sword.

legendary.name: Tentacle (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The hecatoncheires makes a tentacle attack.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The justicator's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}). The justicator can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries: The justicator can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

trait.name: Detect Chaos
entries: The justicator instinctively knows if a creature it can see is of chaotic alignment.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The justicator's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The justicator has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Smite Chaos (1/Turn)
entries: When the justicator hits a creature of chaotic alignment with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The justicator can use its Dimensional Anchor. It then makes two greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) slashing damage. The justicator scores a critical hit on a roll

action.name: Dimensional Anchor (3/Day)
entries: The justicator targets a creature of chaotic alignment that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or be magically bound to the plane it is on for 1 minute, becoming unable to leave the plane by any means.

trait.name: Corpses
entries: When first encountered, the makhai contains the corpses of 6 ({@dice 1d6 + 3}) Medium or Small creatures. The makhai can hold the remains of up to 9 dead humanoids. These remains have total cover against attacks and other effects outside the makhai. If the makhai dies, the corpses within it are annihilated by the resulting explosion.
While it has at least one humanoid corpse within it, the makhai can use its Deploy Sentry action.

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the makhai dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 27} Constitution saving throw, taking 110 ({@damage 20d10}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The explosion can be heard up to 30 miles away.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the makhai fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The makhai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Primordial Attacks
entries: The makhai's weapon attacks are magical. When the makhai hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (included in the attack). This damage ignores resistances and immunities.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The makhai deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Spirit of Battle
entries: Roll a {@dice d6} at the start of each of the makhai's turns. On a roll of 4 or 5, the makhai takes half damage until the start of its next turn, and on a 6, the makhai instead takes no damage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Destructive Leap
entries: The makhai's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 30 feet, with or without a running start. When the makhai lands after jumping, it can take the Shockwave action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Two Heads
entries: The makhai has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition deafened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The makhai makes three glaive attacks and hurls two primordial bolts. It can replace each glaive attack with a primordial bolt.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d10 + 9}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (makhai's choice).

action.name: Primordial Bolt
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 19} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}53 ({@damage 8d10 + 9}) cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (makhai's choice).

action.name: Deploy Sentry
entries: The makhai transforms one dead creature within it, turning it into an ever-forged sentry and ejects it upwards. The sentry smashes into the ground in an unoccupied space within 120 feet of the makhai and acts immediately after it in the initiative order. Each creature within 10 feet of the space of impact must succeed on a {@dc 27} Constitution saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) thunder damage and land {@condition prone}. The sentry acts as an ally of the makhai but isn't under its control.

action.name: Scavenger Harpoon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 19} to hit, range 60 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}22 ({@damage 2d12 + 9}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 22 ({@damage 2d12 + 9}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns. The harpoon and the chain that connects it to the makhai both have AC 22 and can be destroyed by dealing 20 bludgeoning damage or more to it at once. Destroying the harpoon or the chain doesn't hurt the makhai but ends the grapple. If either the harpoon or the chain is destroyed, the makhai can't use this action again until it next finishes a short or long rest.

action.name: Reel
entries: The makhai pulls each creature {@condition grappled} by its scavenger harpoon up to 60 feet straight toward it. If the {@condition grappled} creature is dead and unsecured, the makhai stuffs the corpse into itself, along with any equipment the corpse is wearing or carrying. The remains can be used with the Corpses trait.

action.name: Shockwave {@recharge 5}
entries: A wave of thunderous force that is audible out to 1 mile sweeps out from the makhai. Each creature within 30 feet of the makhai must make a {@dc 27} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from the makhai in a straight line. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed. In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within 30 feet of the makhai are automatically pushed 10 feet away from it.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The makhai makes a glaive attack or a hurls a primordial bolt.

legendary.name: Deactivate Sentries
entries: The makhai causes all ever-forged sentries it has created to die.

legendary.name: Deploy Sentry
entries: The makhai uses its Deploy Sentry action.

legendary.name: Scavenger Harpoon
entries: The makhai uses its Scavenger Harpoon action if it can.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The makhai moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Reel
entries: The makhai uses its Reel action.

trait.name: Two Heads
entries: The sentry has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition deafened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drone makes six melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Ever-Forged Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Forge
entries: The drone targets an ever-forged makhai within 5 feet of it, causing the makhai to regain 20 lost hit points.

action.name: Weld
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

trait.name: Ever-Forged Fury
entries: On each of its turns, the sentry attacks the nearest hostile creature it can see. If no hostile creature is near enough to move to and attack, the sentry instead takes the Dash action and moves as far as it can towards the nearest hostile creature.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The sentry has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the sentry's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The sentry can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The sentry deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Two Heads
entries: The sentry has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition deafened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sentry makes six attacks with its ever-forged blades.

action.name: Ever-Forged Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the makhai dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion can be heard up to 10 miles away.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The makhai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Primordial Attacks
entries: The makhai's weapon attacks are magical. When the makhai hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (included in the attack). This damage ignores resistances and immunities.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The makhai can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The makhai deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Spirit of Battle
entries: Roll a {@dice d6} at the start of each of the makhai's turns. On a roll of 5, the makhai takes half damage until the start of its next turn, and on a 6, the makhai instead takes no damage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Two Heads
entries: The makhai has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition deafened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The makhai makes six attacks: two with its flail, two with its glaive, and two with its war pick. It can instead choose to hurl four primordial bolts.

action.name: Flail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (makhai's choice).

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (makhai's choice).

action.name: War Pick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (makhai's choice).

action.name: Primordial Bolt
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}40 ({@damage 6d10 + 7}) cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (makhai's choice).

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The makhai adds 7 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it.
To do so, the makhai must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the makhai can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the makhai dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion can be heard up to 10 miles away.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The makhai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Primordial Attacks
entries: The makhai's weapon attacks are magical. When the makhai hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (included in the attack). This damage ignores resistances and immunities.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The makhai can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The makhai deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Spirit of Battle
entries: Roll a {@dice d6} at the start of each of the makhai's turns. On a roll of 5, the makhai takes half damage until the start of its next turn, and on a 6, the makhai instead takes no damage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Wildrunner
entries: If the makhai moves at least 5 feet before making a whirlwind sword attack, it makes the attack with advantage.

trait.name: Two Heads
entries: The makhai has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition deafened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The makhai makes four attacks with its whirlwind swords or four attacks with its throwing daggers.

action.name: Whirlwind Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (makhai's choice).

action.name: Throwing Daggers
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (makhai's choice).

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks and weapons that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Graft
entries: The maug has one of the following grafts, determined randomly by rolling a {@dice d20} or chosen by the DM:

trait.name: 1-4: Locking Hand
entries: When the maug makes a slam attack against a Medium or smaller creature, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). The maug can only grapple one target in this manner.

trait.name: 5-7: Rollers
entries: The maug's legs are replaced with six stone cylinders. Its movement speed increases to 60 feet but moving through difficult terrain costs the maug 15 feet of movement for every 5 feet moved.

trait.name: 8-12: Shoving Arm
entries: When the maug makes a slam attack against a creature, the target must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pushed back 5 feet and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: 13-15: Shudder Plate
entries: The maug constantly vibrates. It gains tremorsense out to a range of 60 feet but has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

trait.name: 16-18: Spikes
entries: When a creature touches the maug or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it, the creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: 19-20: Stone Spitter
entries: The maug gains the Stone Spitter Attack.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The maug is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The maug has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The maug's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Rapid Repair
entries: When the maug is reduced to 0 hit points, it comes back to life with all its hit points in {@dice 1d4} hours unless its head is separated from its body.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The maug deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maug makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Geatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stone Spitter (Requires Stone Spitter Graft)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mercane's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence.
It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks), requiring no material components:

trait.name: Arcane Soul
entries: The mercane can attune to up to six magic items and ignores any attunement requirements such as class restrictions.

trait.name: Extradimensional Storage
entries: The mercane can retrieve an item from an extradimensional space or place an item there using an action. The space can hold up to 1,000 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 100 cubic feet.
If the mercane dies, the extradimensional space implodes, and everything inside it appears around the corpse.

trait.name: Stance Dance
entries: At the start of each of the mercane's turns, it can distribute 3 points as it wants to itself. Each point gives the mercane a +1 bonus to either AC, attack and damage rolls, or saving throws. The bonus or bonuses last until the start of the mercane's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mercane makes two falchion attacks.

action.name: Falchion
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The merchurion can squeeze through any space that isn't airtight.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: The merchurion has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The merchurion is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The merchurion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The merchurion's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The merchurion can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices.
A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 17} Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Mimetic Tools and Weapons
entries: The merchurion can transform its hands into simple tools (such as a hammer, hook, or shovel), melee weapons that lack the special property, or back into hands (no action required). When making an attack with a mimetic weapon, the weapon deals three extra dice of its damage when the merchurion hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The merchurion regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn.
If it takes acid or cold damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the merchurion's next turn. The merchurion dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Cold Susceptibility
entries: If the merchurion takes 30 cold damage or more on a turn, it suffers several effects until the end of its next turn: its speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, it can't use reactions or Multiattack, and on its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. The effect ends early if the merchurion takes fire or radiant damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The merchurion makes three attacks with its mimetic weapons.

action.name: Mimetic Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@dice 4d12 + 7}) magical bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (mer- churion's choice).

action.name: Mimetic Reach Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@dice 4d10 + 7}) magical slashing damage.

action.name: Surface Meld
entries: The merchurion flattens itself against a 20-foot flat area that it can touch, such as a floor or a wall, seamlessly melding itself and everything it carries with the surface. Nothing of its presence remains visible or otherwise detectable by nonmagical means.
While melded into a surface in this manner, the merchurion can't make attacks and attack rolls against it are made with advantage.
The effect ends when the merchurion takes an action to end it or when it dies, reappearing in the nearest unoccupied space.

reaction.name: Absorb Properties
entries: If the merchurion is struck by a magic weapon that isn't an artifact, it absorbs the magical properties of the weapon for 1 hour. During this time, the weapon becomes mundane, it loses all remaining charges (if it had any), and any attunement to the weapon is broken (if it required attunement). The merchurion can then choose for its mimetic weapon attacks to gain the benefits that the weapon had when it was magical (no action required). For example, if the merchurion is struck with a flame tongue, the merchurion's can opt to have flames erupt from its mimetic weapons, which then emit bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet, and deal an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a hit. However, a merchurion can't replicate any effect from a magic item that requires charges (such as a luck blade's Wish property).
A merchurion can absorb the magical properties of any number of magical items in this manner, but each mimetic weapon can only be affected by the absorbed properties of one magic item at a time.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The neophane has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Bound Together
entries: The neophane shares its mind with every other neophane on the same plane of existence, and can communicate its thoughts and observations to them instantaneously. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it.

trait.name: Hive Dependency
entries: The neophane dies if it can't share its mind with at least one other neophane using its Bound Together trait.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The neophane can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or become inflicted with an alien disease until cured. While afflicted by this disease, a creature can't understand what other creatures say, can't read, and can speak only in gibberish. All neophanes on the same plane of existence as the diseased target know its location.

action.name: Mind Draining Gaze
entries: The neophane targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Intelligence saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) psychic damage and become {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The swarm has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Bound Together
entries: The swarm shares its mind with every other neophane on the same plane of existence, and can communicate its thoughts and observations to them instantaneously. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The swarm can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Small neophane. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}47 ({@damage 8d10 + 3}) piercing damage, or 25 ({@damage 4d10 + 3}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or become inflicted with an alien disease until cured. While afflicted by this disease, a creature can't understand what other creatures say, can't read, and can speak only in gibberish.
All neophanes on the same plane of existence as the diseased target know its location.

action.name: Mind Draining Gazes
entries: The swarm targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw or take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage and become {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer, the target must instead succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and become {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.

monster.name: Nether Moray
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The nether moray's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 23}), requiring no components:

trait.name: Eldritch Mind
entries: The nether moray is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as to all divination spells. If a creature targets the nether moray with such an effect, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw or gain a Long-Term Madness (see chapter 8 in the Dungeon Master's Guide).

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: The nether moray can magically communicate simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically with any creature within 300 feet of it that can understand a language.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nether moray has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The nether moray's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Oily Skin
entries: The nether moray excretes nonflammable oil from its pores. It can't be {@condition restrained} by sticky materials such as sovereign glue, the web created by the {@spell web} spell, and similar effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nether moray makes five attacks: one with its bite, two with its razor fins, one with its tail, and one with its Jolt. It can use its tongue instead of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 23}).
Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the nether moray can't bite another target.

action.name: Razor Fin
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) piercing damage. The attack scores a critical hit on a roll of 19-
If the nether moray scores a critical hit, it rolls damage dice four times instead of twice.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 6d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Jolt
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 15} to hit, range 300 ft., one target. {@h}55 ({@damage 10d10}) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 30 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 23}) and pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the nether moray. Until the grapple ends, the target takes 19 ({@damage 3d12}) acid damage at the start of each of its turns, is {@condition restrained}, and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the nether moray can't use its tongue on another target.

action.name: Volatile Breath {@recharge 4}
entries: The nether moray exhales otherworldly, purple fumes in a 60-foot cone. The fumes spread around corners, and the area is heavily obscured. The fumes linger in the air until the end of the nether moray's next turn. Each creature that is completely within the cloud at the start of its turn must make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw against disease. On a failed save, a creature's movement speed is halved, it is {@condition blinded}, and it gains blindsight out to a range of 30 feet. The disease remains until cured by a {@spell lesser restoration} spell or similar magic.

If the nether moray hits a target inside the fumes with its Jolt, the fumes explode, forcing each creature completely inside the area to make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Bloodrage
entries: When the orc is below half its hit point maximum, it has advantage on attack rolls and it regains hit points equal to the damage it deals.

trait.name: Cavalry Training
entries: When the orc hits a target with a melee attack while mounted on an aurochs, the aurochs can make a melee attack against the same target as a reaction.

trait.name: Relentless Endurance (1/Day)
entries: When the orc is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, it can drop to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The orc deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The orc's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 30 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: The orc adds its Constitution modifier to its AC.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc makes two unarmed strikes.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet backwards in a straight line or knocked {@condition prone} (orc's choice).

reaction.name: Wounded Retaliation
entries: When the orc is reduced to below half its hit points, it can immediately use its reaction to make an unarmed strike.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The orc is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The orc has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Wisdom of Luthic
entries: The orc gains 11 ({@dice 2d10}) temporary hit points when it causes another creature to regain lost hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc makes tree claw attacks. If Healing Touch is available to use, the orc can use it before or after these attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, any healing it receives before the start of the orc's next turn restores half the normal amount of hit points.

action.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
entries: The orc touches a creature. The target magically regains 20 hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the orc can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Hand of Shargaas
entries: The orc deals 3 extra dice of damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack (included in its attacks).

trait.name: One with the Dark
entries: While in darkness, the orc is {@condition invisible} and can't be perceived by creatures further than 10 feet away from it.

trait.name: Shargaas's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the orc's darkvision.

trait.name: Slayer
entries: In the first round of a combat, the orc has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn yet. If the orc hits a creature that round who was surprised, the hit is automatically a critical hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc makes two handaxe attacks.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shadow Jaunt
entries: The orc magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Both the space it is leaving and its destination must be in dim light or darkness.

action.name: Veil of Shargaas {@recharge}
entries: The orc casts {@spell darkness} without any components. Wisdom is its spellcasting ability.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc makes two greataxe attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: War Drums
entries: The orc plays its war drums to either boost the morale of its allies or sap the morale of its enemies.

action.name: Boost (1/Day)
entries: Each ally within 30 feet of the orc that can hear it becomes immune to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} condition for 1 minute. If a creature is already {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} when it benefits from this effect, the {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} condition is suppressed for the duration.

action.name: March
entries: Each ally within 30 feet of the orc that can hear it is invigorated by the rhythm. Until the start of the orc's next turn, an affected creature's speed increases by 10 feet and it can't gain levels of {@condition exhaustion}. If it is already exhausted, the effect is suppressed for the duration.

action.name: Sap (1/Day)
entries: Each hostile creature within 30 feet of the orc that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Foe Smiter of Ilneval
entries: The orc deals an extra die of damage when it hits with a weapon attack (included in the attack).

trait.name: Into the Fray
entries: The orc adds a {@dice d10} to its initiative rolls.

trait.name: Phalanx Formation
entries: The orc has advantage on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws while standing within 5 feet of an orc ally wielding a shield.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Longspear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or 12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage when used with two hands.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) slashing damage when used with two hands.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Rank and File
entries: When an ally within 5 feet of the orc makes a melee weapon attack, the orc can use its reaction to make a longspear attack.

monster.name: Orc Rot-Guard
languages: understands Common and Orc but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The orc is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The orc has the following spells prepared and can cast them without verbal components:

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Gift of Yurtrus
entries: The orc adds its Constitution modifier to its AC and is immune to disease.

trait.name: Popping Postules
entries: When the orc takes damage, any living creature within 5 feet of the orc takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc makes two attacks with its Deteriorating Touch.

action.name: Deteriorating Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature other than a construct or undead, it takes an additional 6 ({@damage 1d12}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can use an action to make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, ending the effect on a successful save.

action.name: Bolt of Putrescence {@recharge 5}
entries: The orc conjures a ball of horrid pestilence and commands it to dart toward a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 35 ({@damage 10d6}) necrotic damage and become deathmarked. A deathmarked creature has disadvantage on all saving throws until the end of the orc's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't deathmarked.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Gruumsh's Fury
entries: The orc deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage when it hits with a weapon attack (included in the attack).

trait.name: Storm Bound
entries: The orc is magically bound to its stormhammer. If separated, the orc can cause the stormhammer to return to its hand as a bonus action.

In addition, if the orc dies, the stormhammer loses its magic and becomes a normal warhammer. After 1 hour, a nova of lightning bursts out in a 10-foot radius from the warhammer, forcing each creature in the area to make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If the orc's corpse is touched by this lightning, it returns to life with all its hit points and the warhammer regains its magic, becoming a stormhammer once more.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc uses its Thunderous Bellow if it can. It then and makes two stormhammer attacks.

action.name: Stormhammer
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) thunder damage, or 18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) thunder damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) thunder damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.
When thrown, the hammer deals lightning damage instead of the bludgeoning damage, and the stormhammer reappears in the orc's hand immediately after hitting or missing its target.

action.name: Thunderous Bellow {@recharge}
entries: Each hostile creature within 60 feet of the orc must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. While {@condition deafened} in this manner, a creature's movement is halved, it makes attack rolls with disadvantage, and it can't see further than 60 feet. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the orc's Thunderous Bellow for the next 24 hours.
In addition, each of the stormhammer's allies in the area make weapon attacks with advantage until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Diving Smash {@recharge}
entries: If the orc is flying and dives at least 40 feet straight toward the ground, it creates a shockwave upon impact. Each creature within 20 feet of the orc when it lands must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or take 35 ({@damage 10d6}) thunder damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orog can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orog makes two attacks with its chained axes.

action.name: Chained Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Reaping Whirlwind {@recharge}
entries: The orog makes a separate chained axe attack against each creature within 30 feet of it. Each creature that is hit must also succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The orog is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The orog has the following spells prepared and can cast them without verbal components:

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orog can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The orog can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: The orog has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The orog can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Mimetic Tools and Weapons
entries: The orog can transform its hands into simple tools (such as a hammer, hook, or shovel), melee weapons that lack the heavy, two-handed, reach, and special properties (such as a flail, longsword, or warhammer), or back into hands (no action required). When making an attack with a mimetic weapon, the weapon deals two extra dice of its damage when the orog hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The orog regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the orog's next turn. The orog dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the orog is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orog makes two attacks with its mimetic weapons.

action.name: Mimetic Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@dice 3d8 + 4}) magical bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (orog's choice).

action.name: Alter Self
entries: The orog magically changes its appearance until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell), including its height, weight, facial features, hair length, coloration, and other distinguishing characteristics. The orog can even make itself appear as a member of another race, but it can't appear as a creature of a different size than itself.

action.name: Surface Meld
entries: The orog flattens itself against a 10-foot flat area that it can touch, such as a floor or a wall, seamlessly melding itself and everything it carries with the surface. Nothing of its presence remains visible and it is undetectable by nonmagical means.
While melded with a surface in this manner, the orog can't make attacks and attack rolls against it are made with advantage.
The effect ends when the orog takes an action to end it or when it dies, reappearing in the nearest unoccupied space.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The avalaraptor has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The avalaraptor has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the avalaraptor's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The avalaraptor makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny avalaraptor. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Swarm Tactics
entries: The swarm has advantage on attack rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes two attacks with its bites and claws. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bites and Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 12 ({@damage 4d4 + 2}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the cassoraptor can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the cassoraptor moves at least 30 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a head-butt attack on the same turn, the target makes its Strength saving throw against the head-butt attack with disadvantage. If the target is {@condition prone}, the cassoraptor can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Relentless Endurance (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the cassoraptor is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, it drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Smell Fear
entries: The cassoraptor has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell to detect {@condition frightened} creatures and on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track a {@condition frightened} creature. In addition, the cassoraptor can sense a {@condition frightened} creature within 60 feet of it as if it had blindsight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cassoraptor uses its Terrorizing Screech. It then makes a head-butt attack and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d4 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Head-Butt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Terrorizing Screech
entries: The cassoraptor releases a horrible screech that can be heard up to 1 mile away. Each creature within 60 feet of the cassoraptor that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the cassoraptor's Terrorizing Screech for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Continual Parry
entries: The ragewind adds its proficiency bonus to its AC against melee attacks.

trait.name: Ragewind Form
entries: A creature that touches the ragewind or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) slashing damage. In addition, the ragewind can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Magic Damage
entries: The ragewind's slashing damage is magical.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The ragewind has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ragewind makes six blade attacks.

action.name: Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Blade Fury {@recharge 5}
entries: The ragewind momentarily grows in size while its weapons dance and clash at increased speed. Each creature within 15 feet of the rage wind must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Whirlwind
entries: Each creature in the ragewind's space must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) slashing damage and is flung up 20 feet away from the ragewind in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.
If the saving throw is successful, the target takes half the slashing damage and isn't flung away or knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The ragewind magically turns {@condition invisible} until it deals damage or its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rakshasa's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). The rakshasa can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ak'chazar is a 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Grave Magic
entries: When the ak'chazar cast a spell that deals damage, it can change the spell's damage type to necrotic.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the ak'chazar fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The rakshasa is immune to spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be affected. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Necromancy Adept
entries: The ak'chazar deals double damage to undead and its spells ignore resistance to necrotic damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage, and the target is cursed if it is a creature. The magical curse takes effect whenever the target takes a short or long rest, filling the target's thoughts with horrible images and dreams. The cursed target gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The ak'chazar makes a claw attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The ak'chazar casts a spell, expending a spell slot as normal.

legendary.name: Cast At-Will Spell
entries: The ak'chazar casts a spell it can cast at will.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The ak'chazar makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Pain Wave
entries: Each creature of the ak'chazar's choice within 120 feet of it takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) necrotic damage.

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The naityan's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The naityan can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Enhanced Forms
entries: The naityan knows a multitude of supernatural combat styles, each suited for one of the forms the naityan can assume with its Change Shape action.

trait.name: Beast
entries: The naityan's movement speed increases by 10 feet and it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Fiend
entries: The naityan is permanently affected by the {@spell levitate} spell.

trait.name: Humanoid
entries: The naityan automatically succeeds on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

trait.name: Monstrosity
entries: The naityan gains a +2 bonus to its AC.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The naityan is immune to spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be affected. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The naityan makes four melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage, and the target is cursed if it is a creature. The magical curse takes effect whenever the target takes a short or long rest, filling the target's thoughts with horrible images and dreams. The cursed target gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The naityan magically polymorphs into a humanoid, beast, fiend, or monstrosity that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the naityan's choice).

In a new form, the naityan retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.

action.name: Harvest Skull (1/Day)
entries: The naityan harvests the skull of a humanoid that has been dead for no more than 1 hour, imbuing it with fiendish magic and causing the naityan to learn everything the skull's owner knew in life.

action.name: Create Puppet
entries: The naityan channels infernal magic into a skull it has acquired with its Harvest Skull action, causing an imitation of the skull's owner to form from the skull and destroying the skull in the process.

The imitation perfectly resembles the creature it imitates, including its voice and mannerisms, and it has the statistics the imitated creature had in life. A creature intimately familiar with the imitated creature can tell something is off with a passive Intelligence (Investigation) of 18 or higher, and spells and abilities that detect undead reveal the imitation to be so.

The naityan always senses through the imitation in addition to having its own senses. Until the imitation is destroyed, the naityan can use a bonus action to control it until the start of its next turn. If it isn't being controlled, the imitation is {@condition paralyzed}, left in a catatonic state.

action.name: Whispers from the Grave
entries: The naityan whispers into a skull it has acquired with its Harvest Skull action, sending a short message of twenty-five words or less to a creature related to the skull's owner with which the naityan is familiar.
The creature doesn't hear the message but instinctively understands its meaning as if coming from its subconsciousness.
The naityan can send messages in this manner across any distance and even to other planes of existence.

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

headerEntries: The naztharune's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The naztharune can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the naztharune is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The naztharune is immune to spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be affected. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The naztharune deals an extra 21 ({@damage 6d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the naztharune that isn't incapacitated and the naztharune doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The naztharune makes two melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage, and the target is cursed if it is a creature. The magical curse takes effect whenever the target takes a short or long rest, filling the target's thoughts with horrible images and dreams. The cursed target gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shadow Step
entries: The naztharune magically teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space of dim light or darkness that it can see. Before or after teleporting, it can make a weapon attack with advantage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rakshasa's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The rakshasa can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Arms Bond
entries: The rakshasa can take a bonus action on its turn to magically store its sword, shield, and armor in an extraplanar space, or cause the equipment to instantly return to it, wearing the armor and wielding the sword and shield.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the rakshasa hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The rakshasa is immune to spells of 7th level or lower unless it wishes to be affected. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Paladin Hatred
entries: The rakshasa adds a {@dice d8} to attack and damage rolls against paladins.

trait.name: Smite Reflection
entries: If the rakshasa has its shield equipped and a paladin deals radiant damage to it, the rakshasa instead takes no radiant damage and the paladin takes the radiant damage instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rakshasa makes one shield bash attack. It then makes three attack with its claws or its platebreaker sword.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it has disadvantage on saving throws against spells until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target is cursed if it is a creature. The cursed target gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

action.name: Platebreaker Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage. Attacks with this weapon are made with advantage against creatures that wear heavy armor.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the rakshasa can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny rook. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes two attacks, targeting a different target with each attack.

action.name: Beaks

trait.name: Iron Scent
entries: The dragon can pinpoint, by scent, the location and type of any ferrous metal within 30 feet of it.

trait.name: Rust Metal
entries: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the dragon corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the dragon is destroyed after dealing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon uses its antennae and makes a bite attack.

action.name: Bite

action.name: Antennae
entries: The dragon corrodes a nonmagical ferrous metal object it can see within 5 feet of it. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the touch destroys a 1-foot cube of it. If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw to avoid the dragon's touch.
If the object touched is either metal armor or a metal shield being worn or carried, it takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers.
Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object touched is a held metal weapon, it rusts as described in the Rust Metal trait.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The stormghost's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The stormghost has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: The stormghost has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

trait.name: Crackling Aura
entries: The stormghost can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While active, the aura deals 20 lightning damage to any creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of the stormghost.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The stormghost's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Mountain Walk
entries: Moving through difficult terrain made of snow or stone costs the stormghost no extra movement.

trait.name: Static Discharge
entries: Once per turn, when the stormghost hits a target that touches the ground with a melee weapon attack, the stormghost can create a static discharge, dealing an additional 45 ({@damage 10d8}) lightning damage to the target.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The stormghost's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 20 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The stormghost makes one bite attack and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage.

action.name: Impaling Leap
entries: If the stormghost jumps at least 20 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more Medium or smaller creatures. Up to 4 of those creatures of the stormghost's choice must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or be impaled by one of the stormghost's legs, taking 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage and becoming {@condition grappled}. While {@condition grappled} in this manner, a creature is also {@condition restrained}. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage and is pushed 5 feet out of the stormghost's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the stormghost's space.

action.name: Lightning Blast {@recharge 4}
entries: The stormghost focuses its static energy, creating a lightning blast in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
