spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The taniwha's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}). The taniwha can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or somatic components:

trait.name: Corruption Sense
entries: The taniwha can pinpoint any creature or substance within 60 feet of it that is affected by disease or poison, and it can discern the nature of the disease or poison.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The taniwha has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The taniwha has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Sense
entries: The taniwha can pinpoint any magical effect within 60 feet of it, including magic items, creatures affected by magic, and spells being cast, and it can discern the nature of the magical effect.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The taniwha shoots three arcane projectiles or makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Arcane Projectile
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) force damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fearful Instinct (1/Day)
entries: The taniwha magically conjures forth a 30-foot-radius sphere of slowly falling arcane particles centered on a point within 120 feet of it. Each creature in the area that isn't protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, for 24 hours a creature feels intense urge to leave the area and avoid returning to the area as its mind is filled with an implacable dread. For the duration, when such a creature is within 1 mile of the space where it was affected by this ability, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until it is further than 1 mile away from the space. While {@condition frightened} in this manner, a creature can only use its action to take the Dash action and must use its movement to move to away from the space where it was affected by this ability. In addition, when an affected creature loses sight of the taniwha, it loses all memory of the taniwha.

reaction.name: Seize Magic (Recharge 6)
entries: When a creature within 60 feet of the taniwha casts a spell, the taniwha can use its reaction to force the creature to make a {@dc 16} saving throw with its spellcasting ability. On a failed save, the spell fizzles and fails, and the taniwha steals the knowledge necessary for casting the spell. For the next 24 hours, the taniwha knows the spell and can cast it up to 3 times without expending material or somatic components, using Intelligence as its spellcasting ability, and the target can't cast the spell during that time.

monster.name: The Forgotten
languages: understands all languages but can't speak

trait.name: Creature Sense
entries: The Forgotten is aware of the presence of creatures within 1 mile of it that have an Intelligence score of 2 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The Forgotten can't wear or carry anything.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The Forgotten can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: The Forgotten is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the Forgotten's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

trait.name: Invisibility
entries: The Forgotten is {@condition invisible}.

trait.name: Senseless
entries: The Forgotten can't feel, hear, see, smell, or taste anything. It can perceive only with its Creature Sense trait.

trait.name: Stygian Acclimation
entries: The Forgotten is immune to the {@spell feeblemind} spell and the effects of the River Styx.

action.name: Eat Memories
entries: The Forgotten targets one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw or take 44 ({@damage 8d10}) psychic damage and become memory drained until it finishes a short or long rest or until it benefits from the greater restoration or {@spell heal} spell. Constructs, oozes, plants, and undead, as well as creatures protected by the {@spell mind blank} spell succeed on the save automatically.

While memory drained, the target must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from any ability check or attack roll it makes. Each time the target is memory drained beyond the first, the die size increases by one: the {@dice d4} becomes a {@dice d6}, the {@dice d6} becomes a {@dice d8}, and so on until the die becomes a {@dice d20}, at which point the target's Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1 and the creature can't cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. The creature can, however, identify its friends, follow them, and even protect them. The die then doesn't increase further.

When the Forgotten causes a target to become memory drained, the Forgotten gains 10 temporary hit points, learns all the languages the target knows and gains all its proficiencies, except any saving throw proficiencies.

action.name: Read Thoughts
entries: The Forgotten magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature it can sense with its Creature Sense trait. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the Forgotten can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the Forgotten's concentration isn't broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target's mind, the Forgotten can't be perceived or detected by the target by any means, and the target has disadvantage on saving throws against the Forgotten's Eat Memories.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The tirbana's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 11}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The tirbana has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing, sight, or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The tirbana has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the tirbana's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tirbana makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target is {@condition unconscious}. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.
If a creature succeeds on the saving throw or the {@condition poisoned} condition ends for it, it is immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition from a tirbana's bite for 24 hours.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The tirbana has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing, sight, or smell.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the tirbana can regain 10 hit points.

trait.name: Skirmisher
entries: If the tirbana moves at least 10 feet, its claw attacks deal an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage during that turn. In addition, unless the tirbana is flying, opportunity attacks against it are made with disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tirbana makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claw.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target is {@condition unconscious}. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.
If a creature succeeds on the saving throw or the {@condition poisoned} condition ends for it, it is immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition from a tirbana's bite for 24 hours.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drowser's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The tirbana has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The tirbana has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing, sight, or smell.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The tirbana's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tirbana makes two attacks in any combination.

action.name: Acid Orb
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 100 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target is {@condition unconscious}. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.
If a creature succeeds on the saving throw or the {@condition poisoned} condition ends for it, it is immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition from a tirbana's bite for 24 hours.

action.name: Lay Eggs
entries: The tirbana inserts a long, tube-shaped appendage from its abdomen into an orifice of an {@condition unconscious} creature, laying {@dice 1d4} minuscule tirbana eggs inside its body.

Over the next 29 days the host must eat and drink twice as much as usual, as the eggs absorb sustenance and grow within. In the 24-hour period before the eggs hatch, the host is {@condition unconscious} and can't be awoken by any means unless the eggs are destroyed. After this time, the eggs hatch and the newly-born tirbana chew their way through the vital organs and out the target's torso in 1 round, killing the host in the process.
Each egg has a 60% chance of hatching a tirbana drowser, a 30% chance of hatching a tirbana slayer, and a 10% chance of hatching a tirbana spawner.
If the host is subjected to a {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic, the eggs are destroyed. The eggs can't otherwise be removed without killing the host in the process.

action.name: Sleep Drone (1/Day)
entries: The tirbana creates a monotone droning sound to which other tirbana are immune. Each creature within 60 feet of the tirbana must succeed a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or drop {@condition unconscious}. An affected creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The wasp is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The wasp's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wasp makes two stinger attacks.

action.name: Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target, {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage. If the target is a creature that is concentrating on a spell, its next Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration is made with disadvantage.

action.name: Static Discharge {@recharge}
entries: The wasp discharges a bolt of lightning from its stinger, which explodes at a point of its choice that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

monster.name: Warsworn
languages: understands the languages of the creatures it is composed of but can't speak

trait.name: Corpse Swarm
entries: The warsworn takes up its entire space. A Large or smaller creature is engulfed by the warsworn if it enters the warsworn's space, or vice versa. An engulfed creature has three-quarters cover, can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage at the start of each of the warsworn's turns. When the warsworn moves, the engulfed creature moves with it.

An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a {@dc 22} Strength check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the warsworn, landing {@condition prone}.

A creature within 5 feet of the warsworn can take an action to pull a creature or object out of the warsworn. Doing so requires a successful {@dc 22} Strength check, and the creature making the attempt takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

If a creature dies while engulfed by the warsworn or the warsworn engulfs a corpse, the warsworn regains 21 ({@dice 2d20}) hit points. The warsworn can hold any number of Large or smaller creatures, growing proportionally in size.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The warsworn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The warsworn's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The warsworn is immune to any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warsworn uses its Frightful Presence. It then makes two slam attacks or hurls two scrap projectiles.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}40 ({@damage 6d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Scrap Projectile
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}40 ({@damage 6d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the warsworn's choice that is within 120 feet of the warsworn and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the warsworn's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Squeeze
entries: Each creature engulfed by the warsworn must make a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) bludgeoning damage and begins to suffocate. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't begin to suffocate.

monster.name: Voidling
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the voidling is killed, it implodes before releasing a wave of reality-shattering energy. Each creature and object within 10 feet of the voidling takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) cold damage, 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage, and 11 ({@damage 2d10}) radiant damage. Each damage type can be reduced by half with a successful {@dc 12} saving throw: Dexterity against cold, Wisdom against psychic, and Constitution against radiant. Additionally, a creature that fails all three saving throws is magically transported to a random layer on a random plane that isn't the plane the creature is currently on. If a creature dies from this damage, its corpse is sent adrift in a random location within the

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The voidling can't wear or carry anything.

Out-of-Phase Movement. The voidling can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Each creature it moves through takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage; no creature can take this damage more than once per turn. The voidling takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Singularity
entries: Magical darkness fills the voidling's space. No light can exist within the area, whether magical or mundane. A creature that starts its turn within this darkness takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) cold damage.

In addition, when a creature that can see the voidling starts its turn within 120 feet of the voidling, it must make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. A creature that fails the save takes 26 ({@damage 4d12}) psychic damage and makes attack rolls and ability checks with disadvantage until the start of its next turn.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the voidling until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the voidling in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

action.name: Glimpse Eternity
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60 feet, one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage.

reaction.name: Void Absorption
entries: When the voidling takes damage, it reduces that damage

monster.name: Void Hierophant
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the void hierophant is killed, it implodes before releasing a wave of reality-shattering energy. Each creature and object within 30 feet of the void hierophant takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) cold damage, 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage, and 22 ({@damage 4d10}) radiant damage. Each damage type can be reduced by half with a successful {@dc 17} saving throw: Dexterity against cold, Wisdom against psychic, and Constitution against radiant. Additionally, a creature that fails all three saving throws is magically transported to a random layer on a random plane that isn't the plane the creature is currently

trait.name: on
entries: If a creature dies from this damage, its corpse is sent adrift in a random location within the Astral Sea.

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The void hierophant can't wear or carry anything.

Out-of-Phase Movement. The void hierophant can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Each creature it moves through takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage; no creature can take this damage more than once per turn. The void hierophant takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Singularity
entries: Magical darkness fills the void hierophant's space. No light can exist within the area, whether magical or mundane. A creature that starts its turn within this darkness takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) cold damage.

In addition, when a creature that can see the void heirophant starts its turn within 120 feet of the void heirophant, it must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. A creature that fails the save takes 26 ({@damage 4d12}) psychic damage and makes attack rolls and ability checks with disadvantage until the start of its next turn.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the void heirophant until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the void heirophant in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The void hierophant makes three attacks with its Glimpse Eternity.

action.name: Glimpse Eternity
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120 feet, one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage.

action.name: Mind Shatter (1/Day)
entries: Each creature of the void hierophant's choice that is within 30 feet of the void hierophant and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it also becomes insane until it finishes a long rest. While insane, a creature can't take actions, can't understand what other creatures say, can't read, and can speak only in gibberish. A {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic can end the insanity effect early. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Mind Shatter of all void hierophants for the next 24 hours.

reaction.name: Void Absorption
entries: When the void hierophant takes damage, it reduces that damage to 0.

monster.name: Void Titan
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the void titan is killed, it implodes before releasing a wave of reality-shattering energy. Each creature and object within 1 mile of the void titan takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) cold damage, 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage, and 33 ({@damage 6d10}) radiant damage. Each damage type can be reduced by half with a successful {@dc 23} saving throw: Dexterity against cold, Wisdom against psychic, and Constitution against radiant. Additionally, a creature that fails all three saving throws is magically transported to a random layer on a random plane that isn't the plane the creature is currently on. If a creature dies from this damage, its corpse is sent adrift in a random location within the Astral

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The void titan can't wear or carry anything.

trait.name: Gravitational Field
entries: The void titan distorts gravity within 60 feet of it. Within the area, a creature's walking speed is magically halved and jumping distances are tripled, though a creature can only jump in a straight line and doesn't fall at the end of a jump. Creatures that don't have a flying speed and aren't in touch with the ground float in place, oscillating slightly.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the void titan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Out-of-Phase Movement. The void titan can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Each creature it moves through takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage; no creature can take this damage more than once per turn. The void titan takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Singularity
entries: Magical darkness extends 10 feet from the void titan. No light can exist within the area, whether magical or mundane. A creature that starts its turn within this darkness takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) cold damage.
In addition, when a creature that can see the void titan and starts its turn within 120 feet of the void titan, it must make a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw.
A creature that fails the save takes 26 ({@damage 4d12}) psychic damage and makes attack rolls and ability checks with disadvantage until the start of its next turn.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the void titan until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the void titan in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The void titan uses its Mind Shatter. It then makes three attacks with its Glimpse Eternity.

action.name: Glimpse Eternity
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 15} to hit, range 120 feet, one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage.

action.name: Collapse Distance
entries: The void titan warps space around a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. That creature must make a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, the target, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, is magically teleported up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space the void titan can see. All other creatures within 10 feet of the target's original space each take 65 ({@damage 10d12}) psychic damage. On a successful save, the target takes 32 ({@damage 5d12}) psychic damage.

action.name: Mind Shatter
entries: Each creature of the void titan's choice that is within 120 feet of the void titan and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it also becomes insane until it finishes a long rest. While insane, a creature can't take actions, can't understand what other creatures say, can't read, and can speak only in gibberish. A {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic can end the insanity effect early. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the void titan's Mind Shatter for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Open the Void {@recharge}
entries: The void titan causes something to pass through it from the void and into the world, choosing from the options below:

action.name: Infinity (1/Day)
entries: The void itself spills from the void titan, threatening to wreck the minds and bodies of lesser creatures. Each creature within 60 feet of the void titan must make a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 65 ({@dice 10d12}) psychic and is teleported up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space of the void titan's choice.

action.name: Solar Flare (1/Day)
entries: High-intensity solar energy erupts from the void titan as a line that is 500 feet long and 20 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw, taking 110 ({@damage 20d10}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Starfall (1/Day)
entries: The void titan conjures forth a violent torrent of stardust at supersonic speeds, centered on a point it can see within 120 feet of it.

Each creature within 30 feet of the chosen point must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) cold damage and 45 ({@damage 10d8}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the saving throw by 5 or more is also {@condition deafened} for 24 hours.

reaction.name: Void Absorption
entries: When the void titan takes damage, it reduces that damage

legendary.name: Glimpse Eternity
entries: The void titan uses its Glimpse Eternity.

legendary.name: Collapse Distance (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The void titan uses its Collapse Distance.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The void titan teleports up to 100 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the xong-yong dies, it explodes in a thunderous burst.
Each creature within 10 feet of the xong-yong must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The xong-yong can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The xong-yong makes two attacks in any combination.

action.name: Incorporeal Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). If the target is Medium or smaller, it is also {@condition restrained}. When the xong-yong moves, any Medium or smaller target it is grappling moves with it, and its Incorporeal Movement trait is extended to the target for this purpose. If the target is capable of casting a spell that deals force damage, it loses the ability to do so if it starts its turn {@condition grappled} by the xong-yong. The target regains the ability to do so if it finishes a short or long rest.

action.name: Sound Wave
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) thunder damage.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: The cube crawler can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 60 feet of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The cube crawler can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Needle
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target, {@h}1 piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be infected with a disease
- a fungus that will grow into a new cube crawler.

While the fungus grows within a humanoid, the humanoid can respond to the cube crawler's telepathic communications with its Limited Telepathy feature, and they can communicate with each other over any distance, even across planar boundaries. For the duration, the cube crawler does its best to protect the humanoid, and allows the humanoid to mount it.

Only a single fungus can grow within a humanoid at a time. Over one month, the fungus grows until it manifests as a cocoon. In the 24-hour period before giving birth, the host starts to feel unwell, its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. At birth, the cocoon bursts and the newborn cube crawler digs its way out through the respiratory system of its host in 1 round, killing the host in the process.
If the disease is cured before the cocoon is formed, the fungus is destroyed.

action.name: Psychic Drain
entries: The cube crawler targets one creature within 60 of it. The target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage, and the cube crawler regains hit points equal to the damage the creature takes.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The cube crawler magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying and any creatures mounted on it, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the aurochs moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Relentless (recharges after a Short or Long rest)
entries: If the aurochs takes 27 or more damage that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aurochs makes two gore attacks.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the guulvorg can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The guulvorg has advantage on Wisdom (Percep- tion) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The guulvorg can mimic simple screams of pain or panic it has heard, in any language. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom (Insight) check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guulvorg makes two bite attacks and one tail slam attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Unbridled Fury
entries: In response to being hit by a melee attack, the guulvorg can make one melee bite attack with advantage against the attacker.

trait.name: Adamantine Weapons
entries: The bear's weapons are adamantine and it makes its weapon attacks with advantage when attacking a creature that wears heavy armor.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The bear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bear makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) slashing damage.
